mn22:3.8.pli: Appassādā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
mn22:3.8.en: The Buddha says that sensual pleasures give little gratification and [38;5;121mmuch suffering and distress[0m, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.

mn22:3.18.en: a snake’s head, the Buddha says that sensual pleasures give little gratification and [38;5;121mmuch suffering and distress[0m, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.”

mn22:6.3.pli: Appassādā kāmā vuttā mayā, bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
mn22:6.3.en: I’ve said that sensual pleasures give little gratification and [38;5;121mmuch suffering and distress[0m, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.

an5.76:11.2.pli: ‘appassādā, āvuso, kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
an5.76:11.2.en: ‘Reverend, the Buddha says that sensual pleasures give little gratification and [38;5;121mmuch suffering and distress[0m, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.

an5.76:11.12.pli: Sappasirūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
an5.76:11.12.en: a snake’s head, the Buddha says that sensual pleasures give little gratification and [38;5;121mmuch suffering and distress[0m, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.

an5.76:12.2.pli: ‘kiñcāpi, āvuso, appassādā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo;
an5.76:12.2.en: ‘Reverends, even though the Buddha says that sensual pleasures give little gratification and [38;5;121mmuch suffering and distress[0m, and they are all the more full of drawbacks,

an5.76:15.2.pli: ‘appassādā, āvuso, kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
an5.76:15.2.en: ‘Reverend, the Buddha says that sensual pleasures give little gratification and [38;5;121mmuch suffering and distress[0m, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.

an5.76:15.4.pli: Maṁsapesūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā …pe… tiṇukkūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā … aṅgārakāsūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā … supinakūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā … yācitakūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā … rukkhaphalūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā … asisūnūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā … sattisūlūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā … sappasirūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
an5.76:15.4.en: a lump of meat … a grass torch … a pit of glowing coals … a dream … borrowed goods … fruit on a tree … a butcher’s knife and chopping block … a staking sword … a snake’s head, the Buddha says that sensual pleasures give little gratification and [38;5;121mmuch suffering and distress[0m, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.

sn1.20:5.3.pli: Kālikā hi, āvuso, kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā; ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
sn1.20:5.3.en: For the Buddha has said that sensual pleasures take effect over time, with [38;5;121mmuch suffering and distress[0m, and they’re all the more full of drawbacks.

sn1.20:6.1.pli: “Kathañca, bhikkhu, kālikā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo?
sn1.20:6.1.en: “But in what way, mendicant, has the Buddha said that sensual pleasures take effect over time, with [38;5;121mmuch suffering and distress[0m, and they’re all the more full of drawbacks?

mn14:4.1.pli: ‘Appassādā kāmā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo’ti—
mn14:4.1.en: Sensual pleasures give little gratification and [38;5;121mmuch suffering and distress[0m, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.

mn14:5.2.pli: ‘appassādā kāmā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo’ti—evametaṁ yathābhūtaṁ sammappaññāya sudiṭṭhaṁ hoti,
mn14:5.2.en: ‘Sensual pleasures give little gratification and [38;5;121mmuch suffering and distress[0m, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.’

mn54:15.10.pli: ‘aṭṭhikaṅkalūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo’ti.
mn54:15.10.en: ‘With the simile of a skeleton the Buddha said that sensual pleasures give little gratification and [38;5;121mmuch suffering and distress[0m, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.’

mn54:21.21.pli: ‘rukkhaphalūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo’ti.
mn54:21.21.en: ‘With the simile of the fruit tree the Buddha said that sensual pleasures give little gratification and [38;5;121mmuch suffering and distress[0m, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.’

sn4.21:1.10.pli: Kālikā hi, brāhmaṇa, kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
sn4.21:1.10.en: For the Buddha says that sensual pleasures take effect over time; they give [38;5;121mmuch suffering and distress[0m, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.
